|ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:24:A5 |oui = 00:24:A5 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.3 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = 0024A5XXXXXX |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Cameo |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, OpenWrt |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = 2017 |fccapprovdate = 07/21/2009 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 747464120249 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B002WBV2T8 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 5.6 x 4.9 x 1 in. |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9283; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.412 - 2.462 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The device appears to be a Cameo product. The default SSID appears to be the MAC address (no delimiters, upper case hex letters). ==Links of Interest== [http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/WHR-HP-G300N On the DD-WRT wiki]
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=68073 On the DD-WRT forums] (AR9283-AL1A part mention, high res board shot)
[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=23243 On the OpenWrt forums], [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=35721 and again] :This device is apparently now supported in '''Attitude Adjustment'''. [http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Supported_Devices#Buffalo On the DD-WRT Supported Devices table] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buffalo_AirStation Listed on the 'Buffalo AirStation' page on Wikipedia] (note: listed as having 8MB RAM) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v24 SP2 - build 13406 - 20091207 Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/buffalo/buffalo_whr-hp-g300n_v1 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/buffalo/whr-hp-g300n |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 12.09 |current_supported_version = 17.01.2 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==Reverting== ===Reverting dd-wrt=== Per [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=442229#442229 LOM] Set your pc to static ip 192.168.11.2, netmask 255.255.255.0, gateway 192.168.11.1 open a cmd window and type arp -s 192.168.11.1 ro:ut:er:ma:c open your tftp program, enter filename, destination ip and set retries to 100. Don't start the tftp transfer yet.
(Destination is the router at 192.168.11.1) Power on the router, wait 5 seconds and then start the tftp transfer at the pc. It will normally take another 5-10 seconds before the transfer starts. The above works for WHR-HP-G300N which is basically the same router as WHR-HP-GN ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== See images below ==Pictures==
'''User Images''' File:WHR-HP-G300N serial.jpg|
[[Has images::internal| ]] ==Notes== These units not only support DD-WRT, but they ship with it from the factory. You can revert them to Buffalo's proprietary firmware if desired, though that firmware has reduced functionality. Both Buffalo's branded DD-WRT version and the standard DD-WRT distribution version have bugs that lead to crashing under high load, high connection count situations. BitTorrent is particularly problematic. I am not aware of a way to fix this through configuration options and there has been no patch by Buffalo or DD-WRT. OpenWRT "Attitude Adjustment" V 12.09 works ''very'' well on these units and can be flashed from the DD-WRT upgrade page of the web based admin interface using the file openwrt-ar71xx-generic-whr-hp-g300n-squashfs-factory.bin. Â OpenWRT works very well and even under abusive loads remains stable. I consider this the preferred firmware for the device. These routers also have removable antennas and work quite well with enhanced antennas like D-Link's ANT24-0700 Note that all the above information is based on the hardware revision A1 version of the Buffalo WHR-HP-G300N Tachyon - '13 [[Category:English Documentation]]
